text.p: MathSoft Inc said on Thursday it has expanded its focus on the education market through a two-year agreement with McGraw-Hill Co's Higher Education unit over math software.
McGraw Hill Higher Education would publish and distribute the student edition of Mathcad, a MathSoft's technical calculation software tool, the company said.

Under the exclusive agreement, the two companies would work together to develop a special edition of Mathcad tailored to the needs of higher education students and instructors. McGraw Hill would also develop course materials incorporating aspects of Mathcad software, Mathsoft said.
McGraw-Hill Higher Education President Jeff Sund said MathSoft's technology was already prevalent across McGraw Hill's new media product line.
